author: Ray Child, Utah Comcast Examiner
title: Innovations 4 Entrepreneurs Tech Week 2015
text:
Innovations 4 Entrepreneurs Tech Week 2015 Use your key for the next article Google Plus 
Comcast Business is holding a free, week-long series of online programs and events designed to help startups and entrepreneurs understand how best to utilize technology to reach their business goals. The Innovations 4 Entrepreneurs I4E Tech Week will take place August 3-7, 2015. Each of day of this series will focus on a different theme related to technology and starting or growing a business. Industry experts will provide fun and informative content to participants about a variety of topics including finding a mentor, how to turn an idea into reality, how to take a business to the next level, how technology has changed over the last 20 years, and how technology will change business in the future. Twitter chats, webinars, and custom content will be available throughout the week on the Comcast Business Community website. 
Entrepreneurs who are interested in participating in I4E Tech Week can find more information and sign up at cbcommunity.comcast.com/ Suggested Links Utah Comcast Examiner As a Senior Director of Public Relations for Comcast, Ray Child is responsible for the company’s news media relations, community relations and employee communications in Utah and Arizona. Ray’s responsibilities include leading the local development of company initiatives including Comcast Cares Day, an annual day of volunteerism in which Comcast employees, their families and community volunteers join in a day of service to benefit organizations and people in need. In 2014, nearly 9,000 volunteers participated in Comcast Cares Day in Utah and Arizona. He manages Comcast’s support of the United Way through employee giving campaigns and company participation in the LIVE UNITED campaign. Comcast was named the Outstanding Corporate Partner by the United Way of Salt Lake in 2012. Ray has also created public relations strategies to successfully launch numerous products and services in Utah and Arizona. Prior to joining Comcast, Ray held management positions with companies in the telecommunications industry. He developed a public relations strategy to announce a company sponsorship of the 2002 Olympic Winter Games in Salt Lake City, which resulted in the company’s most widely covered news media event. He also created and implemented a communications strategy that helped a company win the Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award. Ray graduated from the University of Utah with a bachelor’s degree in Speech Communications.
